reviews.review_msg: I am shocked at the number of bad ratings for this lady. She is amazing. So sweet and clear at explaining concepts I found very intimidating. I did great in this course thanks to her great style and organization. She's amazing.

Lectures are useless- didn't ever go. Only attended Tutorials & I had an amazing TA. I didn't even buy the book- but do study her lectures notes cus sometimes she summarizes important "theories." Exams are tough but go to J's cram session & ask for help in tutorials. Make sure you practice examples!!

How is she still teaching this class...?? You can read the text and grasp the material before lecture, go to class and come out totally lost. Attend tutorial and take a lot of notes, rely heavily on the T.A. Midterm worth 40%, final worth 60%. GO TO TUTORIAL ALWAYS! Nice enough woman but cannot teach.

Looking back, I probably shouldn't have gone to lectures. Not only was it just not helpful, it made things a thousand times harder than they needed to be. The material is not hard, it's her wordings and explanations that confused almost all of the class. Exams were much easier than expected based on material presented in class. Depend on your TAs.

Very lady/quirky lady but to repeat what others said, she presents the material as much more difficult than it actually is. I had an amazing TA who explained things much more clearly. You don't really have to go to class (so boring) as long as you read the text.

She is super nice. Her lectures aren't that clear, but it helps a LOT if you read the textbook before lecture and then go to the tutorials and do your hw. Tests aren't difficult, just be sure to study theory (from the text) as well as how to do computational problems.

She's really nice, but she teaches material in a very complex way. My TA (Patrick) taught me everything I learned. Content/Exams aren't too bad. Put in a decent amount of work, ask questions in tutorials, attend J's cram sesh and you should be good.

When in class the material is really confusing, but I found that if you went to her office hours she went over it in much more detail and a clearer manner. I had a terrible TA who was fairly useless. Definitely make sure you understand how to apply the concepts! Overall Rachel is a really nice prof, just seek her out during office hours

She seems really nice and I kind of feel bad saying this but she is THE WORST PROF EVER! I cannot explain how bad of a prof she is, she does NOT know how to explain things clearly. TA's make everything clear and the cram session with jay was AMAZING LOVE HIM so good at explaining things/funny Overall, go to tut and you'll do decent.

At first this class seemed really hard, but I think that was just because she made the material way tougher than it needed to be. My TA helped me through this class and I ended up with an A. Midterm and final were actually very easy, in comparison to the way the material was presented in lecture. GPA boost.

She will be no help, makes content 1000% harder than it needs to be. Its not a hard class, just taught improperly. Once the Ta went over, it was clear. ALWAYS go to tutorial and study hard for the midterm (40%) to help boost your grade. I didnt and had too much pressure for final (60%)

Honestly I'm not sure what ppl are talking about saying how she's a bad prof... The material is hard for sure and I freely admit I'm probably one or the worst when it comes to math and she explained things really well.  She genuinely cares about her students succeeding and is always available outside class for questions.  Very approachable.

Course is difficult becuase most psyc students are not used to seeing #s/graphs in this way. TA/Tutor is mandatory because Fouldadi is terrible at teaching. I attended most classes but honestly learned nothing from her.Not good at expressing concepts.Goes round in circles about unimportant material.Hope shes gone soon since most profs can do better

Bad prof. She serisouly should not be teaching. She flies over important concepts. For m/c exams she actually puts e)none of the above. She told us before the exam there would only be 1 answer none of the above so if we got more than 1 we were wrong somewhere, turns out there were 3. Not nice! TA's are a must, but if you get David Prime, switch!

I'm sure she has a good heart but I really do not like her style. She is over the top with her screaching voise and hands above her head when lecturing. She talks way too much during exams. During lecture info that can be explained in 5 mins takes her 20 mins. Good news is course is easy. Be best friends with your TA as they are helpful.

Very nice lady, incompetent prof!! Makes the class way harder than it needs to be, an awesome TA will be your best friend for this course. She spends WAY too much time going over useless information and flies over important formulas. Ended up with a decent mark but had to work very hard for it...avoid taking this class with her at all costs.

Yes, this class can be considered difficult. The concepts are not easy for someone who is not familiar with statistics (like me). I dreaded taking the class. She wants to help, if you want her to slow down, ask her she is happy to go over anything. Use the textbook, talk to TA's! With dedication I got an A+ and hate statistics a little bit less.

She is an incompetent teacher. She gives too much importance to irrelevant things and doesnt explain important concepts very well. She doesn't believe in brackets "()" in formulas so doesn't include them in the questions. But to get the right answer you have to pretend the brackets are there. She doesn't know what shes teaching!

This course should NOT be taken with her. Take this course with someone else if you can. She makes the concepts harder than need be and elaborates on things that don't need elaborating, zooms by things that does need explaining. she's a nice lady but terrible at teaching. TAs are a must!! as is the textbook.

well, I have to say she is a nice prof, but the way she presents the materials are really difficult,she teaches quite differently from the text as well as the TA's,however,TA are EXTREMELY important!!Also,do attend her lecture because she gave out a lot of examples that she might include in her exams.
She made this course seem harder than it actually is. Read the textbook and get help from your TA, you will be fine. Nice person though. Hate the assignments, so time consuming.

Ridiculous class. The lectures were so boring, the assignments were SO time consuming for a mere 3%, not to mention not even that helpful for studying for exams. The exams are all MC, with SIX options. If this class consisted only of a lecture I would not understand anything. An awesome TA is the only reason I'm getting a decent mark in the class.

Rochelle spends way too much time explaining simple things and then flies over the difficult formulas and questions. Her assignments are ridiculously long and too difficult (50 true or false Qs, seriously?!) and have nothing to do with the midterm/final. A colossal waste of time, and in the end, only worth 3% of your final grade.

She is the worst teacher I've ever had. She treats you like a preschooler, giving a billion examples for unnecessary items (i.e. 10 is greater than 5 which is greater than 3). It's a mandatory course but I actually dropped it to take it with anothe professor just cause of her. She's nice but extremely redundant.
of course it's boring, it's statistics, what do you expect? i love her enthusiasm though! and all her jokes. shes a riot. you can tell she really cares about her students.

I agree that she is indeed a very nice person. Assignments are tricky but tests are not hard (the questions are usually from the textbook). But her 3-hour lecture is like the most boring lecture I've had to listen in my entire life. She talks too much about something that is not that important. And there is only one washroom break.

Rochelle is a VERY nice person - very animated and obviously very interested in the material. Her lectures are a bit chaotic and disorderly although the exams are more than fair. Do not miss any classes as it will haunt you later (there is no webct component or recorded lectures for this class). Tutorial assignments had little relevence for exams.

This class was a lot of work, I did it during summer session, but Fouladi was helpful; very passionate, she really truly cared about if we understood.  I recommend this class during summer session, but KEEP ON TOP of your readings! The tests are all MC, yay, but they're tricky, so watch out!

Assignments are not easy, but exams are all multiple choice. If you know all the notes and assignments, you'll do well on exams. She's very passionate and enthursiastic about stats, and makes jokes that don't seem funny at all. Lecture is really boring, but still go just cause those are the things that will be on the exam. Office hours help too.
she's a nice person but she's a little spacey & over dramatic. Can't say she's the best prof but her exams are all MC. Class is boring, no need goin to class. just read the text and her notes.

Very friendly and ENTHUSIASTIC, but kinda all over the place.  Will spend a lot of time on easy things then blaze through the hard stuff.  Tests all multiple choice.  Don't fall behind or you'll be screwed...

Rachel is very nice and obviously interested in what she teaches, but spends way too long on the easy stuff and rushes through the difficult things. Hwk takes a long time and worth very little, but help to study. Lectures make you want to sleep.
very dry and boring...hard not to sleep in the class. she tries to make it as simple as possible. too much hw. i found the midterms (all mc) to be brutal, unlike others. read all her notes carefully!

Class material is not that difficult, but she makes it very complicated. She adds too many unnecessary words to throw you off. HWs are pretty tough but midterm was easy. Definitely need tutorials. TAs very helpful.

Her hw is sometimes hard, so go and ask the t.a.(s) Her midterm is really easy. You might as well just read her notes, because she teaches more than the book has.  She is kinda slow but it helps to drop down what she saids because she includes it similarly in midterm.
